messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Operating Budget of Revenues for the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to appropriate funds to the New Orleans City Council to fund an initiative to return funds to victims of crime who were charged to retrieve stolen property. It was referred back to the Budget Committee for additional amendments.
- Ordinance Number: 33,623 - 28970 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a vote of 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Tags/Keywords: New Orleans City Council, budget appropriation, victims of crime, amendments
- UID: 11d60b0a-bf9c-4e16-b805-b7304be0b71f
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 3-24-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Ordinance No. 33,623
- Summary: The amendment proposed by Councilmember Moreno aimed to increase the figures from 150,000 to 650,000 in multiple sections of the ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: 33623 AMD 1
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The figures in the ordinance were successfully amended as proposed by Councilmember Moreno.
- UID: b265f4c8-8f1f-4b6f-869e-df8a196a494c

- Topic: Amendment to Ordinance No. 33,623
- Summary: An additional amendment, proposed by Councilmember Green and seconded by Councilmember Harris, was made to the ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: 33623 AMD 2
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The additional amendment passed, and the motion was then passed as amended.
- UID: b265f4c8-8f1f-4b6f-869e-df8a196a494c
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 3-24-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Operating Budget Appropriation for Crime Victims
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend the Operating Budget of Expenditures for the City of New Orleans for the Year 2022 to appropriate funds to the New Orleans City Council to fund an initiative aimed at returning funds to victims of crime who were charged to retrieve stolen property. An amendment was made to change the recipient of the funds from the New Orleans City Council to the Chief Administrative Office.
- Ordinance Number: 33624
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment to change the recipient of the funds from the New Orleans City Council to the Chief Administrative Office passed.
- UID: bd826b78-0f7e-4b6d-9832-c5ad0effe10c
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 3-24-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Budget Figures
- Summary: The ordinance proposed to replace the figure 150,000 with 650,000 in several lines of the budget.
- Ordinance Number: 33624 AMD 2
- Votes Summary:

    Vote 2: As Amended - PASSED - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for Workforce Development Funds
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend the operating budget for the City of New Orleans to appropriate Federal Dislocated Worker Funds for workforce development in areas affected by Hurricane Ida. The Budget Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33635 - 28973 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, and the budget amendment was approved.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget Committee, Operating Budget, Workforce Development, Hurricane Ida
- UID: 115c1ee7-2ae4-41a8-9d87-2fe38e2581e3

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Lafitte Greenway
- Summary: This ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City of New Orleans, the NORD, and Friends of Lafitte Greenway to maximize the use of the Lafitte Greenway for public recreational purposes. The Budget Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33636 - 28974 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, and the Cooperative Endeavor Agreement was approved.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Lafitte Greenway, Recreational Use
- UID: 115c1ee7-2ae4-41a8-9d87-2fe38e2581e3

- Topic: Public Use and Enjoyment of Lafitte Greenway
- Summary: This ordinance, introduced by Councilmembers Moreno, Giarrusso, Green, and Morrell, aims to maximize the Lafitte Greenway for public recreational use and enjoyment in the City of New Orleans. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33640 - 28976 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, and the public use and enjoyment of the Lafitte Greenway was approved.
- Tags/Keywords: Lafitte Greenway, Public Recreational Use, Public Enjoyment
- UID: 115c1ee7-2ae4-41a8-9d87-2fe38e2581e3

- Summary: The ordinance aimed to appropriate American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) funds to support gas utility assistance programs and reduce gas utility costs for residential gas customers in New Orleans. It was recommended for approval by the Budget Committee and was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33654 - 28981 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Litter Abatement Program for Bar Owners
- Summary: The ordinance requires bar owners to provide a litter abatement program letter, approved by the Department of Sanitation, and to install bicycle racks with a minimum of two parking spaces. The ordinance also specifies guidelines for trash storage and periodic clearing of litter from sidewalks.
- Ordinance Number: 25
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed with 5 YEAS and 2 council members absent.

- Topic: Conditional Use Request
- Summary: The motion overruled and granted the conditional use request recommended by the City Planning Commission's report, with modifications. Proviso No. 1 was removed, and 19 additional provisos were added.

The emergency declaration will otherwise continue until terminated in accordance with the law.

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Operating Budget for the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance proposed to amend the operating budget to allocate funds for the Mayor’s Office of Homeland Security and provide support for senior living facilities and vulnerable residents following natural disasters. An amendment was also proposed to reallocate funds between the Department of Health and the Mayor’s Office. The ordinance was electronically submitted and discussed.
- Ordinance Number: 33662 - 28985 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)

- UID: c61e73cf-3be5-472c-82f1-84fee95d9990
